## Evolution by natural selection
<hr>

**<span style="color:blue">Natural Selection</span>: Differences among individuals in a population in survival and reproduction**

<br/>

**<span style="color:blue">Fitness</span>: Measure of ability to survive and reproduce**

<br/>

**<span style="color:blue">Adaption</span>: A trait that confers an advantage in a particular environment that evolved via natural selection**

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:400px; LEFT:0px; WIDTH:1100px; HEIGHT:275px" SRC="images/adaption.png">

## What did Darwin mean by *fitness*?
<hr>
<br/>

<div style="float: left; width: 68%;">

* **Best suited for the environment**
    + biggest?  fastest?  strongest? smartest?

<br/>

* **He intended "fittest" to mean the members of the species best suited for the *immediate* environment**
    + individual needs the most favorable traits to survive in the environment
    + environments can change at any time
    
<br/>

* **Those lacking the favorable traits—the "unfit"—most likely won't live long enough to pass down their unfavorable traits**
    + those traits will be breed out of the population
    + 'breeding out' traits can take a long time

</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:240px; LEFT:700px; WIDTH:350px; HEIGHT:300px" SRC="images/malaria.jpg">

## Conditions necessary for natural selection
<hr>
<br/>

* **<span style="color:darkred">Variation</span>: Individuals in a population vary **
    + *mutation* as ultimate source of variation
    + *migration* -> gene flow within species
    + *hybridization* -> introgression across species

<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

* **<span style="color:darkred">Heredity</span>: Offspring resemble parents **
    + DNA as primary mechanism of heredity

<br/>

* **<span style="color:darkred">Differential survival or reproduction</span>: Not all individuals survive, those with favorable traits survive and reproduce**
